RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Possui graduao em Qumica Tecnolgica Bacharelado pela Pontifcia Universidade Catlica de Campinas (2008), mestrado (2011) e doutorado (2015) pela Ps-Graduao em Cincia e Tecnologia/Qumica, Universidade Federal do ABC, orientada pela Profa. Dra. Paula Homem de Mello. Foi bolsista FAPESP durante o doutorado. Fez doutorado sanduche na Itlia, orientada pela Profa. Dra. Benedetta Mennucci. Fez ps-doutorado no Departamento de Qumica do Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (ITA), sob superviso do Prof. Dr. Francisco Bolivar Correto Machado e participa de projeto com Prof. Dr. Hans Liscka, Prof. Dr. Luz Fernando Ferro e Profa. Dra. Dana Nachtigallova. Atualmente faz ps-doutorado na Universidade de So Paulo (USP) sob superviso da Profa. Dra. Kthia Maria Honrio, cujo projeto se intitula "Uso de mtodos de simulao computacional para gerao de descritores empregados em modelos de regresso QSAR visando o desenvolvimento de candidatos a frmacos". Alm disso, participa do projeto intitulado "Estudo Terico de Propriedades Eletrnicas de Porfirinas por meio de Mtodos ab initio" no programa Pesquisador Doutor Colaborador (PDC) na Universidade Federal do ABC. Principal rea de atuao: qumica terica (quntica e clssica), biofsica. Palavras chave: Mtodos multiconfiguracionais, CI, CASPT2, DFT, TD-DFT, estados excitados, porfirinas, ftalocianinas, clorinas, xantenos, fenotiazinas, acenos, periacenos, terapia fotodinmica (PDT), dimeros, solvatao (IEFPCM), corantes, QSAR, descritores.
ORCID iD http://orcid.org/0000-0002-3576-8891
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
1023/5000
She holds a bachelor's degree in Technological Chemistry from the Pontifical Catholic University of Campinas (2008), a master's degree (2011) and a doctorate (2015) by the Post-Graduation in Science and Technology / Chemistry, Universidade Federal do ABC, quided by Dr. Paula Homem de Mello. She was a FAPESP fellow during hes doctorate. She did a doctorate sandwich in Italy, guided by Profa. Dr. Benedetta Mennucci. She did post-doctorate in the Department of Chemistry of the Aeronautical Technological Institute (ITA), under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Francisco Bolivar Correto Machado and participates in a project with Prof. Dr. Hans Liscka, Prof. Dr. Luiz Fernando Ferro and Profa. Dr. Dana Nachtigallova. Today she does post-doctoral in the Universidade de So Paulo (USP) with the project "Computational simulation methods for generation of descriptors used in QSAR regression models aimed at the development of drug candidates" under supervision of Profa. Dra. Kthia Maria Honrio. Also, she participates of a collaborative doctor program in UFABC university. Main area of ​​practice: theoretical chemistry (quantum and classical), biophysics. Keywords: Multifunctional methods, IC, CASPT2, DFT, TD-DFT, excited states, porphyrins, phthalocyanines, chlorines, xanthenes, phenothiazines, acenes, periacenes, photodynamic therapy (PDT), dimers, solvation (IEFPCM), dyes, QSAR, descriptors.
ORCID iD http://orcid.org/0000-0002-3576-8891

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Comparison of UV-visible spectra of free-based and Zn-coordinated phthalocyanines ? A methodological study
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Comparison of UV-visible spectra of free-based and Zn-coordinated phthalocyanines ? A methodological study

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: International Academy of Quantum Molecular Science

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras atividades profissionais, cientficas e tcnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Phthalocyanines (Pc) have been studied in many fields such as chemistry, medicine and industry because they present interesting properties as a two-dimensional 18 π-electron conjugated system, a variety of coordination number and high redox capacity. Due to these properties, they can be applied in solar cells, optical sensors, semiconductors and catalysis. These dyes can also be employed in photodynamic therapy, and, to clarify the excited state dynamics and relaxation, in this work we have carried out a computational study to complement the experimental studies in this area [1-4]. This study aims to seek the best TD-DFT-based methodology for simulating the absorption spectrum of free-based Pc (Figure 1) and Pc coordinated to Zn (ZnPc). We have compared the UV-visible spectra obtained with B3LYP, B3PW91 and M06-L functionals with 6-31g(d) basis set and B3LYP functional with DGDZVP basis set, as implemented in Gaussian 09. The solvent (THF) was simulated with the continuum solvation model IEFPCM (using Gaussian 03 defaults). Soret band of free-based Pc was better reproduced with B3LYP/6-31g(d). However, the overall experimental behavior for both systems (free-based Pc and ZnPc) was better reproduced by B3LYP/DGDZVP, particularly the differences between Qy and Soret bands.

Acknowledgements: FAPESP (proc. 07/05370-0 and 10/19790-3) and UFABC.

References:
1 Chaudhuri, T., Nayak, S.K., Chattopadhyay, S., e Banerjee, M. Spectrochimica Acta Part a-Molecular and Biomolecular Spectroscopy, 76, 230-238, 2010.
2 Liao, M.S., Watts, J.D., e Huang, M.J. Inorganic Chemistry, 44, 1941-1949, 2005.
3 Yao, P. et al. Vibrational Spectroscopy, 50, 169-177, 2009.
4. Ribeiro, A. O. unpublished data.
